snippet: An internal debate over how hard the party should work to win over white men has emerged as support from female and minority voters grows.
abstract: Democratic Party is undergoing significant internal debate over how hard it should work to win back white males as it increasingly gains support from female and minority voters; Democrats in favor of new strategy say the white male vote is particularly potent in midterm elections, but others warn that entrenched attitudes are too difficult to change; party generally wins the votes of fewer than four in 10 white men.
lead_paragraph: An internal debate over how hard the party should work to win over white men has emerged as support from female and minority voters grows.

headline.main: Democrats Try Wooing Ones Who Got Away: White Men
headline.print_headline: Democrats Try Wooing Ones Who Got Away: White Men
